meanings.definition: One who contradicts or denies something.
meanings.sent1: The gainsayer always disagreed with everyone in the group.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the gainsayer because she never believed anything without proof.
meanings.sent3: The gainsayer at the party kept insisting that the sky was actually green.
meanings.sent4: He was a gainsayer of happiness, always finding something negative in every situation.
meanings.sent5: The gainsayer's constant skepticism made it hard for others to trust his opinions.

meanings.sent1: I hope you don't gainsayer my plans for the weekend.

meanings.sent3: The child loves to gainsayer his parents just for fun.
meanings.sent4: His actions gainsayer his words, showing his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The scientist refused to gainsayer the evidence presented in the research paper.
